question: Apart from saving energy, what benefit do longer-lasting light bulbs provide regarding landfill waste?

content.source_1: Compact fluorescent lamps (CFLs), an energyâ€‘saving replacement for incandescent bulbs, are commonly advertised to last up to ten times longer; over the same hours of lighting, this means far fewer bulbs are used and ultimately thrown away.
content.source_2: Items placed in household trash are typically sent to municipal landfills; when fewer objects are discarded, less waste enters landfills.
content.source_3: Reducing the amount of material sent to landfills is considered an environmental benefit because landfills occupy land and can pollute air and water.
content.source_4: CFLs contain a small amount of elemental mercury sealed in the glass tube.
content.source_5: In practice, many spent CFLs are not recycled and are disposed of with regular household trash, where breakage can release mercury.
content.source_6: Mercury released from broken or improperly disposed CFLs is toxic to people and wildlife and contributes to environmental contamination, which is considered environmentally harmful.

answer: Less trash is put in landfills.
